s12: The seventy disciples orally received their transmitted pointers, as there were writings of criticism, ridicule, praise, concealment, yielding, and reduction that could not be seen in writing.
s13: The Lu gentleman Zuo Qiuming feared that disciples would each follow different doctrines, each settling on their own intentions and losing the truth, thus because of Confucius' historical records he fully discussed their words, completing the Zuoshi Spring and Autumn Annals.
s14: Duo Jiao transmitted for Chu King Wei, as the king could not fully observe the Spring and Autumn Annals, selected successes and failures, finally made forty chapters, for the Duoshi subtle commentary.
